M r s Political Agent, Bahrain. Memorandn-m^ .Vith reference to the practice of your countersigning licenses of Bahrain boats who purpose to ply for trade outside Bahrain waters. This procedure originated I believe in the early days of the war when conditions in Bahrain were very unlike what they are today. I understand that the intention ° f th unon Stem W&S t0 enable the Political Agent to keep a check pK the tea trade. I suggest that the necessity for this countersignature no longer exists and as it merely causes unncessary work it should no longer be insisted upon.- All boats now have licenses from the Bahrain Government and unless there is any particular reason for the countersignature, of which I am unaware, I see no reason for its continuance.Till!] CUSTOMHOUSE, BAHRAIN: r 23rd April, 1932., No PA/CR/.^|. 17th Bhulhaj, 135 r . , H.B.M 1 s Political Agent, BAHRAIN: MEMORANDUM: - SS H . P.—L (IN) 129—500-4-31. The Political Agency, Bahrain, Dated the M.tli La/ To The Secretary to the Hon’ble the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, BUSHIRE. MEMORANDUM. At present all Bahrain craft which propose to ply m for trade outside Bahrain waters have their Bahrain craft apparently arose during the war and in this connection dated the Eord July 1917 referring to yorr Memorandum No:0/hl5 dated the 2 nd July 1917. it appears to me that this registration is no longer ' # of any value^for we do not keep a record of these craft and after signing the licence,for which incidentally no <L fee is required,the licence is merely returned to the Lirector of Customs to be given to the^obat owners. Unless there be any reason of which I am unaware,for the continuation of this war-time practice,I propose to inform the Bahrain Government that my countersignature is no longer required for their jo at licences / ana tnat of the Lirector of Customs, who issues them is sufficient. licence endorsed by the Political igent. This practice Political Agent, 4 ' Bahrain.I enclose herewith Craft Fegistratjon Certificate No:dh^/U2. for the favour of your countersignature, please, and return. To The Secretary to*the Hon’ble the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, bushire. MEMORANDUM. Lne Muhsmad bin All. an Iranian subject residing at Bahrain, recently visited Gandar ohahpur with his sailing boat which had been registered at Bahrain under No.250/1. C, Dalrymple Belgrave, Esq., Adviser to the Government, I REGISTRATION OF NEW BAHREIN. f TUG-BOAT ^KARZAKKAJI* 1 File 237 Dear Sir, We are now having built in the United States a new tug-boat, which will weigh about 195 tons and have a length of approximately 85 feet. This tug will be diesel powered. It will be named 'KARZAKKAN' We plan to have this tug-boat registered in Bahrein, home port Sitra. * Our New York office has asked us to cable them the following points concerning registration Official Registry Number. Official Registration Form - (if special form is not obtainable the Company will provide a suitable form). It is planned to place the name of the home port and country of registration on the stern of the boat. Will you please advise on the above as soon as possible so that we may cable the information to our New York Office. Yours very truly, RAAtJA W. P. Anderson. Chief Local Representative THE BAHREIN PETROLEUM COMPANY LIMITED. cc. E.B.M*s Political Agentm=m Septaisber 24, 194$ Adviser to the Bahrein Government, JUBBIIE* RKGISTHaTIOW OF Ni’W LAUNCH 1 jWAlXHIA' File * 637 ^ear sir, BaWain Rec ei 9^, ^ SVn Date ITo We have just received a new diesel powered towing launch, 33 length; 10 feet 6 inches beam; 4 feet draft; welded steel hull; which will be named 'MALCHIA'. Please send registry papers to be filled out by us and returned to you for certification. Home port is to be Sitra, Bahrein. ELH/PBM Yours very truly, ©IflK'JWHAt SIGNED BY W. P. ANDERSC ~ P. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 6/20 Bahrain Country Crafts registered at Customs - Certificates Countersigned by Political Agent'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 191; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-188; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence relating to the registration of boats in Bahrain. The vast majority of the papers are covering letters that were originally sent with registration certificates by the Director of Customs to the Political Agency for counter-signing. The certificates were then returned by the Agency. The certificates were required by all craft intending to leave Bahrain waters. The practice ceased in January 1933.The file also contains some correspondence about the usefulness of the procedure, mostly between the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain (Charles Dalrymple Belgrave), the Political Agency in Bahrain, the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, and the Government of India (Foreign and Political Department).Towards the back of the file is later correspondence relating to an incident involving the confiscation of registration certificates by Iranian port officials and a request to register a new tug boat from the Bahrain Petroleum Company (BAPCO).Folio 189 is internal office notes.

name.namePart: Government of India, Foreign and Political Department
Director of Customs and Port Officer
